intro: Warszewiczia maynensis, commonly known as the Maynensis warzewiczia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Lythraceae, which includes plants such as the poinsettia. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in yellow or green. It is often found in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in humid forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
